query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Taciti, soli, sanza compagnia 2 n’andavam l’un dinanzi e l’altro dopo, 3 come frati minor vanno per via.
query.result:
**English:**
1 Silent, alone, without company, 2 we went, one in front and the other behind, 3 as friars minor go on their way.
**Cornish:**
1 Tacet, onan, heb companieth, 2 nynj a eas, an eyl orth ha'n aral war-nans, 3 dell freers minor a wra yn fordh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 E come l’un pensier de l’altro scoppia, 11 così nacque di quello un altro poi, 12 che la prima paura mi fé doppia.
query.result:
**English:**
10 And as one thought bursts forth from another, 11 so another was born from that one, 12 which doubled my initial fear.
**Cornish:**
10 Ha kepar ha bos a wra dheglos, 11 felly re beu unn aral, 12 owth omma an kynsa ofn a dhebell.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 Io pensava così: ‘Questi per noi 14 sono scherniti con danno e con beffa 15 sì fatta, ch’assai credo che lor nòi.
query.result:
**English:**
13 I thought to myself: ‘These people are mocked 14 with such harm and mockery 15 that I truly believe they are saying no to us.’
**Cornish:**
13 Me a vynnas felly: ‘An re ma 14 yw skoornyes gans niver ha gans golwg 15 mar dha, owth yma kresi owth ens nans yw.’

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 Se l’ira sovra ’l mal voler s’aggueffa, 17 ei ne verranno dietro più crudeli 18 che ’l cane a quella lievre ch’elli acceffa’.
query.result:
**English:**
16 If anger is added to ill will, 17 more cruel ones will come after them 18 than the dog after the hare that it catches.
**Cornish:**
16 Mar wra an grev war an golwg drog gonan, 17 moyha kruele ages re dheuth warnen 18 ages an kolgi dhe’n vrav a wra gonan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 Già mi sentia tutti arricciar li peli 20 de la paura e stava in dietro intento, 21 quand’ io dissi: «Maestro, se non celi
22 te e me tostamente, i’ ho pavento 23 d’i Malebranche. Noi li avem già dietro; 24 io li ’magino sì, che già li sento».
query.result:
**English:**
19 Already I felt all my hairs stand on end 20 with fear and I stood back, intent, 21 when I said: “Master, if you do not hide
22 yourself and me quickly, I fear 23 the Malebranche. We have them behind us already; 24 I imagine them so much that I can already hear them.”
**Cornish:**
19 Me a vynnas oll ow blew an blew 20 gans an ofn ha me a sevas yn keffrys, 21 pan wov: “Mester, mar nyns keth 22 ty ha my a-dhia, owth yma ofn 23 rag an Malebranche. Nyns yw owth honan; 24 y’m a wra gonan mar dha, owth yma klevys.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 E quei: «S’i’ fossi di piombato vetro, 26 l’imagine di fuor tua non trarrei 27 più tosto a me, che quella dentro ’mpetro.
query.result:
**English:**
25 And he: “If I were made of leaded glass, 26 I would not draw your outward image to me 27 any quicker than I do the one I hold within.
**Cornish:**
25 Ha henna: “Mar vynnavow gweder plomm, 26 nyns owth tynjyn owth an-mes a-dhia 27 moyha byster ages henna a wra y’m.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 Pur mo venieno i tuo’ pensier tra ’ miei, 29 con simile atto e con simile faccia, 30 sì che d’intrambi un sol consiglio fei.
query.result:
**English:**
28 Yet your thoughts came to me 29 with a similar gesture and a similar face, 30 so that I made a single plan from both of them.
**Cornish:**
28 Mes owth tynjyn owth an-mes dheuth dhe’m, 29 gans an keth par ha gans an keth fas, 30 mar dha owth ny owth unn konsel a wruthyl.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 S’elli è che sì la destra costa giaccia, 32 che noi possiam ne l’altra bolgia scendere, 33 noi fuggirem l’imaginata caccia».
query.result:
**English:**
31 If it is so that the right-hand bank is sloping, 32 so that we can descend into the other pouch, 33 we will escape the imagined hunt.
**Cornish:**
31 Mar yw mar dha an fordh dhe dhehu 32 mar a alla ni dheuth dhe’n bolgia aral, 33 ny a dheuth dheworth an helghys a wra gonan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 Già non compié di tal consiglio rendere, 35 ch’io li vidi venir con l’ali tese 36 non molto lungi, per volerne prendere.
query.result:
**English:**
34 I had not yet finished giving such advice, 35 when I saw them coming with their wings spread, 36 not very far away, to seize him.
**Cornish:**
34 Nyns o compleys dhe'n keusel del henna, 35 ow kovsys vy dhe'n dos orth aga'n askel, 36 nyns dhe'n bell bell, rag ev dhe'n kemer.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 Lo duca mio di sùbito mi prese, 38 come la madre ch’al romore è desta 39 e vede presso a sé le fiamme accese,
40 che prende il figlio e fugge e non s’arresta, 41 avendo più di lui che di sé cura, 42 tanto che solo una camiscia vesta;
43 e giù dal collo de la ripa dura 44 supin si diede a la pendente roccia, 45 che l’un de’ lati a l’altra bolgia tura.
query.result:
**English:**
37 My leader suddenly seized me, 38 like a mother who is awakened by a noise 39 and sees the flames burning close to her,
40 who seizes her child and flees and does not stop, 41 caring more for him than for herself, 42 so that she wears only a chemise;
43 and down from the neck of the hard bank 44 he gave himself supine to the sloping rock, 45 which blocks one of the sides of the next pouch.
**Cornish:**
37 An dywghugh a'm kemeras a'm kymmeras dhesempys, 38 kepar an mamm a vydh degesys gans an sôn 39 ha gweles an flammow loskys ogas esa,
40 a gymmer an mab ha'n teves ha na wra dalleth, 41 ow tos owna moy es ytho es, 42 kepar dell yw onan gamis a wiska;
43 ha war-nans a'n golon a'n glann gallos 44 a ros yn supin dhe'n garrek omwisk, 45 ow tos onan a'n tu a'n bolja nessa tura.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 Non corse mai sì tosto acqua per doccia 47 a volger ruota di molin terragno, 48 quand’ ella più verso le pale approccia,
49 come ’l maestro mio per quel vivagno, 50 portandosene me sovra ’l suo petto, 51 come suo figlio, non come compagno.
query.result:
**English:**
46 Water never ran so swiftly through a millrace 47 to turn the wheel of a mill on the ground, 48 when it approaches closest to the paddles,
49 as my master did along that narrow path, 50 carrying me on his chest, 51 like his son, not like a companion.
**Cornish:**
46 Nyns teves dowr bythkweth dhesempys a-dreus 47 dhe droy wheyl molin war an nor, 48 pyw ytho moy dhe'n palow omwisk,
49 kepar ha'm mester a-dreus an fordh nagh, 50 ow portha owna moy war-nans y brust, 51 kepar y vab, nyns kepar kethres.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 A pena fuoro i piè suoi giunti al letto 53 del fondo giù, ch’e’ furon in sul colle 54 sovresso noi; ma non lì era sospetto:
55 ché l’alta provedenza che lor volle 56 porre ministri de la fossa quinta, 57 poder di partirs’ indi a tutti tolle.
query.result:
**English:**
52 His feet had scarcely reached the bottom 53 when we were on the hill 54 above us; but there was no fear there:
55 for the high providence that willed them 56 to be ministers of the fifth chasm 57 takes away from all the power to depart from there.
**Cornish:**
52 A-bennans o an treys o'y vras o dheuth 53 dhe'n gweliow, pan o o yn war an bre, 54 ughella dhyn; mes na veu dowt ena:
55 rag an arbennaskorra a vynnas dhedha 56 dhe vos mesterow a'n pympves fos, 57 a gymmer gallus dhe bub tra dhe dhyski.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 Là giù trovammo una gente dipinta 59 che giva intorno assai con lenti passi, 60 piangendo e nel sembiante stanca e vinta.
query.result:
**English:**
58 There below we found a painted people 59 who went around very slowly, 60 weeping and in their appearance tired and defeated.
**Cornish:**
58 Ena-nans yma kavos pobel lywys 59 ow tos a-dro dhesempys gans passys lent, 60 ow kewina ha yn aga semlant stanc ha gwaynys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 Elli avean cappe con cappucci bassi 62 dinanzi a li occhi, fatte de la taglia 63 che in Clugnì per li monaci fassi.
query.result:
**English:**
61 They had cowls with hoods lowered 62 in front of their eyes, made in the style 63 that is made for the monks in Cluny.
**Cornish:**
61 Aga o veu hucow gans hucow isel 62 ow tos ogas aga lagha, gwres gans an gwella 63 a vydh gwres rag an monkow yn Clugnì.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 Di fuor dorate son, sì ch’elli abbaglia; 65 ma dentro tutte piombo, e gravi tanto, 66 che Federigo le mettea di paglia.
query.result:
**English:**
64 On the outside they are gilded, so that they dazzle; 65 but inside they are all lead, and so heavy 66 that Frederick would have considered them made of straw.
**Cornish:**
64 A-ves yw aga our gans our a-dhalgh; 65 mes a-dhiwnder aga ollom plomm, ha kepar poos, 66 bythkweth na vynnas Frederick aga dhe wul a-well.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 Per ch’io al duca mio: «Fa che tu trovi 74 alcun ch’al fatto o al nome si conosca, 75 e li occhi, sì andando, intorno movi».
query.result:
**English:**
73 Wherefore I said to my leader: "Make sure you find 74 someone who can be recognized by his deeds or his name, 75 and as you go, keep your eyes moving around."
**Cornish:**
73 Rag henna vy dhe'm dywghugh: "Gwre dha kavos 74 neb a yll bos aswonnys gans y ober po y hanow, 75 ha'th lagha, kepar ha tos, a-dro a remov."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 E un che ’ntese la parola tosca, 77 di retro a noi gridò: «Tenete i piedi, 78 voi che correte sì per l’aura fosca!
79 Forse ch’avrai da me quel che tu chiedi».
query.result:
**English:**
76 And one who understood the Tuscan word, 77 cried out from behind us: "Hold your feet, 78 you who run so through the murky air!
79 Perhaps you will have from me what you ask for."
**Cornish:**
76 Ha neb a glewas an ger toskan, 77 a-dheler dhyn a grys: "Gwithowgh aga treys, 78 why a red yn kepar dreus an awel tewl!
79 Mar pleg y fydh genowgh gansow vy henna a vynnygh."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
80 Onde ’l duca si volse e disse: «Aspetta, 81 e poi secondo il suo passo procedi».
82 Ristetti, e vidi due mostrar gran fretta 83 de l’animo, col viso, d’esser meco; 84 ma tardavali ’l carco e la via stretta.
query.result:
**English:**
80 Whereupon the leader turned and said: "Wait, 81 and then proceed at their pace."
82 I stopped, and I saw two showing great eagerness 83 in their spirits, with their faces, to be with me; 84 but the burden and the narrow way delayed them.
**Cornish:**
80 Rag henna an dywghugh a droas ha leverel: "Gorthugh, 81 ha wosa henna yn-dann y gammow a-rag."
82 Y'm sevel, ha'm gwelas dew a-dhiskwedha brassa fromma 83 a'n aga speres, gans aga semlant, dhe vos gansow; 84 mes an poos ha'n fordh kul an lettya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 Quando fuor giunti, assai con l’occhio bieco 86 mi rimiraron sanza far parola; 87 poi si volsero in sé, e dicean seco:
88 «Costui par vivo a l’atto de la gola; 89 e s’e’ son morti, per qual privilegio 90 vanno scoperti de la grave stola?».
query.result:
**English:**
85 When they had come outside, they looked at me askance 86 without saying a word; 87 then they turned to each other and said among themselves:
88 "This one seems alive from the way he moves; 89 and if they are dead, by what privilege 90 do they go uncovered by the heavy robe?"
**Cornish:**
85 Pan vons i a-ves, kaletter an golwg an golwg 86 a'm welas heb kewsel ger; 87 wosa henna i droes yn aga-hwegh, ha leverel:
88 "An onan-ma henna byw orth an fordh a'y geg; 89 ha gen i ow marow, dre boes privilej 90 ens i ow diskudhys gans an stola poos?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 Poi disser me: «O Tosco, ch’al collegio 92 de l’ipocriti tristi se’ venuto, 93 dir chi tu se’ non avere in dispregio».
query.result:
**English:**
91 Then they said to me: "O Tuscan, who have come to the college 92 of the sad hypocrites, 93 do not disdain to tell us who you are."
**Cornish:**
91 Wosa henna i leverel: "O Toscan, pyth es deuth 92 dhe'n koleji a'n ipokritis trist, 93 na wra dhespis dhe leverel dhyn henwyn."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 E io a loro: «I’ fui nato e cresciuto 95 sovra ’l bel fiume d’Arno a la gran villa, 96 e son col corpo ch’i’ ho sempre avuto.
query.result:
**English:**
94 And I to them: "I was born and raised 95 above the fair river Arno in the great city, 96 and I am with the body that I have always had."
**Cornish:**
94 Ha my a-gorra: "My a veu genys ha magys 95 war-tu an avon Arnow yn an cita magh, 96 ha my yw gans an korf a'm beusistens byth."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 Ma voi chi siete, a cui tanto distilla 98 quant’ i’ veggio dolor giù per le guance? 99 e che pena è in voi che sì sfavilla?».
query.result:
**English:**
97 But who are you, from whose cheeks I see 98 such sorrow distilling down? 99 And what is the pain in you that so sparkles?"
**Cornish:**
97 Mes pyth ywghwi, dhe byth ken a-dhystlir 98 kyns vyth a welaf dolur a-wals an dhewelyn? 99 Ha pyth pena yw ynwi a-skyn?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 E l’un rispuose a me: «Le cappe rance 101 son di piombo sì grosse, che li pesi 102 fan così cigolar le lor bilance.
query.result:
**English:**
100 And one of them answered me: "The orange cloaks 101 are of lead, so heavy that their weight 102 makes their scales creak."
**Cornish:**
100 Ha onan a-gorra dhym: "An kappennow 101 yw a-blymm orth marow, marowder yw an posow 102 a wra an bilansennow aga-grygya."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 Frati godenti fummo, e bolognesi; 104 io Catalano e questi Loderingo 105 nomati, e da tua terra insieme presi
106 come suole esser tolto un uom solingo, 107 per conservar sua pace; e fummo tali, 108 ch’ancor si pare intorno dal Gardingo».
query.result:
**English:**
103 We were Jovial Friars, and Bolognese; 104 I am Catalano and this one Loderingo 105 by name, and we were taken together from your land
106 as a solitary man is often taken 107 to preserve his peace; and we were such 108 that it is still evident around the Gardingo."
**Cornish:**
103 Broder godenti o ni, ha bolognesi; 104 My yw Catalano ha hemma Loderingo 105 henwys, ha ni veu kemeres orth a'ga dheryow
106 kepar ha'n den unnik a vydh kemeres 107 rag dhe witha y hedh; ha ni veu kepar henna, 108 bythken yw kler war-dro dhe'n Gardingo."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 Io cominciai: «O frati, i vostri mali . . . »; 110 ma più non dissi, ch’a l’occhio mi corse 111 un, crucifisso in terra con tre pali.
query.result:
**English:**
109 I began: "O brothers, your sufferings . . . "; 110 but I said no more, for my eye fell 111 on one crucified on the ground with three stakes.
**Cornish:**
109 My a-commensis: "O broder, aga-dhonni . . . "; 110 mes na leveris moy, rag dhe'n golwg a-geris 111 unn, a veu krosefyes war an nor gans teyr pal.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 Quando mi vide, tutto si distorse, 113 soffiando ne la barba con sospiri; 114 e ’l frate Catalan, ch’a ciò s’accorse,
115 mi disse: «Quel confitto che tu miri, 116 consigliò i Farisei che convenia 117 porre un uom per lo popolo a’ martìri.
query.result:
**English:**
112 When he saw me, he twisted all over, 113 blowing on his beard with sighs; 114 and the Catalan friar, who noticed this,
115 said to me: "That crucified one whom you are looking at 116 advised the Pharisees that it was necessary 117 to put one man to death for the people."
**Cornish:**
112 Pan welas henna, oll a-droes, 113 ow soffla yn y varv gans sisyow; 114 ha'n broder Catalan, a welas hemma,
115 a leveris dhym: "An konfithes henna a weles, 116 a gonselis an Fariseys ev o vew 117 dhe gorra unn den dhe'n bobel dhe'n merthyryow."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 Attraversato è, nudo, ne la via, 119 come tu vedi, ed è mestier ch’el senta 120 qualunque passa, come pesa, pria.
query.result:
**English:**
118 He is stretched out naked across the road, 119 as you see, and it is necessary that he feel 120 the weight of everyone who passes by, before.
**Cornish:**
118 A veu treusys, noeth, war an fordh, 119 kepar ha'th weles, ha mester yw ev a-sent 120 poes oll unn a dremenoth, kyns.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 E a tal modo il socero si stenta 122 in questa fossa, e li altri dal concilio 123 che fu per li Giudei mala sementa».
query.result:
**English:**
121 And in this ditch his father-in-law is tormented 122 in this manner, and the others from the council 123 that was evil seed for the Jews."
**Cornish:**
121 Ha yn an fordh-ma hemma y soker a-stent 122 yn an foss-ma, ha'n re erel a'n konsel 123 a veu dhe'n Yedhewon had seedh drok."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 Allor vid’ io maravigliar Virgilio 125 sovra colui ch’era disteso in croce 126 tanto vilmente ne l’etterno essilio.

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 Poscia drizzò al frate cotal voce: 128 «Non vi dispiaccia, se vi lece, dirci 129 s’a la man destra giace alcuna foce
130 onde noi amendue possiamo uscirci, 131 sanza costrigner de li angeli neri 132 che vegnan d’esto fondo a dipartirci».
query.result:
**English:**
127 Then he turned to the friar and said in a gentle voice: 128 "Do not be displeased if you are permitted to tell us 129 if there is any outlet on the right-hand side
130 through which we both can escape, 131 without having to compel the black angels 132 to come up from this abyss to separate us."
**Cornish:**
127 Wosa henna dewis dhe'n broder gans dowr: 128 "Na vynsiwgh dheugh, mar plegys vy dhe'n hwedhel, 129 hag yn-dann dhe'n dhew dhe-glew yma unn fordh
130 may hallen ni oll an dhew a-ves, 131 hebma bos dhe'n enjyl du dhe'n dos dhe'n-nans 132 dhe'n dos dhe'n-nans dhe'n-nans dhe'n dos dhe'n-nans."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 Rispuose adunque: «Più che tu non speri 134 s’appressa un sasso che da la gran cerchia 135 si move e varca tutt’ i vallon feri,
136 salvo che ’n questo è rotto e nol coperchia; 137 montar potrete su per la ruina, 138 che giace in costa e nel fondo soperchia».
query.result:
**English:**
133 He replied: "Sooner than you hope, 134 a rock is approaching, which from the great circle 135 moves and crosses all the wild valleys,
136 except that in this one it is broken and does not cover it; 137 you will be able to climb up the ruin, 138 which lies on the slope and juts out at the bottom."
**Cornish:**
133 Ev a-dhemedhas: "Rag dheugh na wra vy 134 yma garrek a-nesa a'n keth bras 135 a wra a-hedhi ha treusi oll an glynnow gwyls,
136 mes y'n unn-ma yma ythollys ha na wra a-dhiwedhes; 137 hwi a-hall y'n gallos dhe'n fordh-hwedhel, 138 hag y'n gorwedhes war an-dann ha war-ves."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
139 Lo duca stette un poco a testa china; 140 poi disse: «Mal contava la bisogna 141 colui che i peccator di qua uncina».
query.result:
**English:**
139 The leader stood for a while with his head bowed; 140 then he said: "He who ensnares the sinners here 141 gave a poor account of the matter."
**Cornish:**
139 An ethak a-savsa an ethak gans y ben ow, 140 wosa henna dewis: "An gwella a-wra gonis 141 an neb a wra a-gweres an pechoryon ama."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
142 E ’l frate: «Io udi’ già dire a Bologna 143 del diavol vizi assai, tra ’ quali udi’ 144 ch’elli è bugiardo, e padre di menzogna».
query.result:
**English:**
142 And the friar: "I once heard it said in Bologna 143 that the devil has many vices, among which I heard 144 that he is a liar and the father of lies."
**Cornish:**
142 Hag an broder: "My a glewas yn Bologna 143 a-wra dhe'n jowl meur a-dro dhe'n jowl, y'n mysk 144 ev a-wra gelvygor ha tas an golhegow."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
145 Appresso il duca a gran passi sen gì, 146 turbato un poco d’ira nel sembiante; 147 ond’ io da li ’ncarcati mi parti’
148 dietro a le poste de le care piante.
query.result:
**English:**
145 Then the leader went on with great strides, 146 his face somewhat troubled with anger; 147 whereupon I left those burdened souls
148 and followed in the footsteps of his dear feet.
**Cornish:**
145 Wosa henna an ethak a-hedhas gans passow meur, 146 y'n galon ow a-dhovi gans gorra, 147 wosa henna my a-barthas a'n dus an-dann
148 wosa henna my a-hedhas war-lergh y'n garow chier.
